item.title: Julie add a quote by Anne Rice
item.description: "I wasn't sent here to find angels! I wasn't sent here to dream of them. I wasn't sent here to hear them sing! I was sent here to be alive. To breathe and sweat and thirst and sometimes cry." -- Anne Rice

item.title: Julie add a quote by Alfred Edersheim
item.description: "God is the God of the present as well as of the future...even here on earth, He reigneth, dispensing good and evil." -- Alfred Edersheim

item.title: Julie add a quote by Arthur Golden
item.description: "I dont think any of us can speak frankly about pain until we are no longer enduring it." -- Arthur Golden

item.title: Julie add a quote by Amy Tan
item.description: "Isn't hate merely the result of wounded love?" -- Amy Tan

item.title: Julie add a quote by Gabriel García Márquez
item.description: "[The captain] looked at Florentino Ariza, his invincible power, his intrepid love and was overwhelmed by the belated suspicion that it is life, more than death, that has no limits." -- Gabriel García Márquez

item.title: Julie add a quote by William W. Purkey
item.description: "You've gotta dance like there's nobody watching, Love like you'll never be hurt, Sing like there's nobody listening, And live like it's heaven on earth." -- William W. Purkey

item.title: Julie add a quote by Alexandre Dumas
item.description: "As a general rule...people ask for advice only in order not to follow it; or if they do follow it, in order to have someone to blame for giving it." -- Alexandre Dumas

item.title: Julie add a quote by Fred Chappel
item.description: "Wine still tastes for me of the mountaintop of piny woods with a warm spring dawn coming on, and that Spanishy word, Sonoma, is an exotic flavor all to itself." -- Fred Chappel

item.title: Julie add a quote by Jonathan Safran Foer
item.description: "This was the world in which she grew and he aged. They made for themselves a sanctuary from Trachimbrod, a habitat completely unlike the rest of the world. No hateful words were ever spoken, and no hands raised. More than that, no angry words were ever spoken, and nothing was denied. But more than that, no unloving words were ever spoken, and everything was held up as another small piece of proof that it can be this way, it doesn’t have to be that way; if there is no love in the world, we will make a new world, and we will give it heavy walls, and we will furnish it with soft red interiors, from the inside out, and give it a knocker that resonates like a diamond falling to a jeweler’s felt so that we should never hear it. Love me, because love doesn’t exist, and I have tried everything that does." -- Jonathan Safran Foer

item.title: Julie add a quote by M.T. Anderson
item.description: "It is ever the lot of children to accept their circumstances as universal, and their particularities as general." -- M.T. Anderson

item.title: Julie add a quote by M. T. Anderson
item.description: "It boots us nothing to feel rage for things that long ago transpired. We must curb our fury, and allow sadness to diminish, and speak our stories with coolness and deliberation." -- M. T. Anderson

item.title: Julie add a quote by M. T. Anderson
item.description: "This, you must understand, Octavian, is the true and sublime end of discipline: that you may rise into a new and glorious buoyancy." -- M. T. Anderson

item.title: Julie add a quote by Jane Yolen
item.description: "Fairy Tales always have a happy ending.' That depends... on whether you are Rumpelstiltskin or the Queen." -- Jane Yolen

item.title: Julie add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "What a wee little part of a person's life are his acts and his words! His real life is led in his head, and is known to none but himself. All day long, the mill of his brain is grinding, and his thoughts, not those of other things, are his history. These are his life, and they are not written. Everyday would make a whole book of 80,000 words -- 365 books a year. Biographies are but the clothes and buttons of the man -- the biography of the man himself cannot be written." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Julie add a quote by Nicholas Sparks
item.description: "But...as bad as it was, I learned something about myself. That I could go through something like that and survive. I mean, I know it could have been worse--a lot worse-- but for me, it was all I could have handled at the time. And I learned from it." -- Nicholas Sparks
